The desire for safety from theocratic fascists with a desire to kill us doesn't boil down to a simple case of wanting to be or thinking we have some right to be anywhere. My support for any defense posture which includes pre-emptive action against emerging threats does not eminate from some simple desire to play the bully. I would prefer very strongly that US troops not be needed or desired anywhere but at home raising and loving their families and I feel no envy for soldiers in harms way fighting an often unseen, undetected ruthless enemy in the hills of Afgahnistan or the streets of Bagdad. You are certainly correct to point out that foreign policy mistakes will lead to future disasters. I think it's safe to say that 9-11 and the resulting wars are a case study in how our past failures can lead to such disasters. In any case we have been dragged into a civil war over the future of Islam and the middle east and we are on the right side of that conflict because we have to be.
